hardware/sierra/swiril/swiril_device_qmi.c File Reference

Provides device related QMI based Sierra functions. More...

bool IsOMADMSessionPending ( void   ) 

Is there a pending/active OMADM session, so that an attempt to start a new data session should not be allowed.

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
true : pending OMADM session; do not start new data session false : no pending OMADM session; okay to try starting new data session
Note:
none
bool IsSierraDevice ( void   ) 

To identify if the device is a Sierra device.

Parameters:
none 
Returns:
true : if the device is a Sierra device false : if the device is not a Sierra device
Note:
none
static void pollOMADMSessionInfoCDMA ( void *  params  )  [static]

Sub-function to handle the actual processing required in response to an OMADM Session state notification event.

This function is enqueued by the actual callback handler, setOMADMAStateCallback().

Parameters:
sessionstate [In]

  • The session status being reported by the modem through its callback
failurereason 
  • Indicates the reason why the session failed if "sessionstate" indicates a failure
Returns:
  • None
Note:
  • Runs in the context of the Sierra RIL

static void setActivationStatusCB ( ULONG  activationStatus  )  [static]
void setOMADMAStateCallback ( ULONG  sessionState,
ULONG  failureReason 
)

Callback function for OMADM State Changes.

This function is installed at startup to register the callback. OMADM sessions can be client- initiated or network-initiated. Once a session is underway, this callback communications the session status.

Parameters:
sessionstate [In]

  • The session status being reported by the modem through its callback
failurereason 
  • Indicates the reason why the session failed if "sessionstate" indicates a failure
Returns:
  • None
Note:
  • Runs in the context of the SLQS package's notification handler

Set power off by using QMI API.

Returns:
true - the modem switches to airplane mode false - otherwise
Abort:
none
Note:
none
